intro: Stenandrium scabrosum subsp. punctatum, commonly known as the rough stenandrium, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough stems and lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive pubescent surface. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
